passages.text: **Virgin Australia Holdings Ltd (VGN.AX)**
**Steady start; can the Domestic market sustain supply?**

Overall an in-line result, with few surprises given prospectus forecasts were provided with a month remaining in the financial year. Looking forward, revenue growth is expected to be strong, although it appears industry costs are rising and operating leverage will be more muted, with all 3 domestic airline brands talking to above GDP/trend capacity and price growth. We remain cautious as to whether the market can sustain this level of supply. As a result, we remain Neutral-rated.

**FY25 pro-forma in-line** — Pro-forma EBIT of $649M was largely in-line (vs. VA cons $643M). Fuel ($1,091M vs cons $1,104M) and costs were modestly better (albeit $105M IT/transformation costs were below the line). Compositionally, Airlines EBIT of $535M was +2% ahead (vs. pros of $526M), while Velocity was largely in-line ($127M vs. pros of $126M). No profit guidance was provided, although 1H26 RASK is expected to increase 3-5% on top of ~4% domestic ASK capacity.

**Can the market hit price AND volume expectations?** — Looking forward, we estimate HSD revenue growth, largely driven by ~4% RASK (midpoint of guide) and a ~3% capacity outlook, which is below the 1H26 guidance. However, despite our conservatism, we remain cautious as: 1) peers have also talked to strong MSD domestic growth targets; 2) government data shows pax growth exited JunQ at only LSD; and 3) cancellation rates have historically averaged LSD to keep LF and yields high. As a result, we are cautious as to whether volumes can hit these targets.

**Implications** — Following the result, we increase our EBIT 3-6% through FY26/27 driven by a strong outlook for revenue. However, we estimate operating leverage will be more muted given increases in staff, airport and maintenance costs that are expected to be above inflation (similar to peers). Our target price increases to $3.80 per share as a result of our higher estimate revisions; however we remain Neutral as we remain cautious about the industry's domestic growth targets.
Source: Company Reports and dataCentral, Citi Research.

Pro-forma EBIT of $649M was largely in line with consensus of $643M. Operating expenses performed better with fuel ($1,091M vs cons $1,104M) and costs ($105M IT/transformation costs below the line), while revenue was largely as expected ($5,810M vs cons $5,803M).
Figure 2. FY25 result summary (in $M, unless otherwise mentioned)

Spread 39pp Current Price and expected returns (upside/downside) as of 29 Aug 2025
ASK growth faster than expectations. Better than expected fuel tailwinds.
FY26e revenue grows \(7\%\) while EBITDA margins expand to \(20\%\)
Margin compression and lower RASK.

Virgin Australia provides airline services primarily in the domestic Australian and international markets. Domestically, Virgin operates primarily in the premium leisure, SMEs and value- conscious corporate segment. Aside from targeted SHI routes, Virgin provides LHI services with international airline partners such as Qatar Airways, United Airlines and Singapore Airlines.

We rate Virgin as Neutral. Our base case models a largely stable top- line environment with expansion driven by fuel. However, we are cautious given the building risks in the domestic market and lack of growth options.
Our target price of \(\) 3.80\(is derived by the blended average of:
- DCF valuation of \(\) 3.60\(- Sum - of - the - parts valuation of\) \ \(4.00\)
Our DCF valuation is derived by using an equity beta of 1.2 and WACC of \(9.4\%\) . We use a terminal growth rate of \(2.0\%\) .
Our sum- of- the- parts valuation is derived by applying a 4x multiple to our FY26e EBITDA forecasts.
The stock is High Risk based upon our quantitative model, but we have not assigned a High Risk rating as we expect Virgin to continue to see flat growth supported by a rationale market.
We see the following risks to achieving our forecasts, valuations and target price:

- Competition: Virgin competes directly and indirectly in the domestic/international market against several other airlines. Aggressive pricing or adding additional capacity to routes served by Virgin could impact financial performance.

- Economic outlook: Ticket sales are broadly correlated to GDP growth, business confidence and discretionary spending. Prolonged periods of slow growth/depressed spending would impact revenue generation. In contrast, any increase in consumer spending through fiscal or monetary policy stimulus may be a positive for demand, and result in better-than-expected financial performance.
- Jet fuel: Jet fuel prices can be impacted by several factors including global economic growth, geopolitical tensions or increased demand resulting from
disruptions to the supply chain. We see upside/downside risk to margin performance resulting from decrease/increase in jet fuel prices.

- Customer retention: Virgin's inability to retain existing/attract new customers or penetrate new segments of the market would impact financial performance. The success of Virgin's loyalty program also depends on customer engagement and loyalty.

- Forex risk: Virgin undertakes transactions other than AUD for the purchase of aircrafts, jet fuel, lease payments, etc. Virgin also has debt denominated in currencies other than AUD. Significant increase/decrease in currency rates could positively/negatively impact financial conditions and performance.

- Safety incidents: Safety incidents pertaining to fleet performance or grounding of a particular aircraft type due to ongoing concerns would impact capacity, affect scheduling as well as on-time flight performance.

- Technology failure: Virgin relies on in-house/third-party technology providers for its operational needs. A technology failure could impact financial performance. Additionally, failure to safeguard customer data from cyber hacks could result in brand and financial losses.

- Personnel risk: Retaining key employees and attracting new talent is imperative to Virgin's success. Inability to retain existing/attract new talent could impact business success and financial performance.

Citi Research stock recommendations include an investment rating and an optional risk rating to highlight high risk stocks. Risk rating takes into account both price volatility and fundamental criteria. Stocks will either have no risk rating or a High risk rating assigned.

Investment Ratings: Citi Research investment ratings are Buy, Neutral and Sell. Our ratings are a function of analyst expectations of expected total return ("ETR") and risk. ETR is the sum of the forecast price appreciation (or depreciation) plus the dividend yield for a stock within the next 12 months. The target price is based on a 12 month time horizon. The Investment rating definitions are: Buy (1) ETR of 15% or more or 25% or more for High risk stocks; and Sell (3) for negative ETR. Any covered stock not assigned a Buy or a Sell is a Neutral (2). For stocks rated Neutral (2), if an analyst believes that there are insufficient

valuation drivers and/or investment catalysts to derive a positive or negative investment view, they may elect with the approval of Citi Research management not to assign a target price and, thus, not derive an ETR. Citi Research may suspend its rating and target price and assign "Rating Suspended" status for regulatory and/or internal policy reasons. Citi Research may also suspend its rating and target price and assign "Under Review" status for other exceptional circumstances (e.g. lack of information critical to the analyst's thesis, trading suspension) affecting the company and/or trading in the company's securities. In both such situations, the rating and target price will show as "-" and "-" respectively in the rating history price chart. Prior to 11 April 2022 Citi Research assigned "Under Review" status to both situations and prior to 11 Nov 2020 only in exceptional circumstances. As soon as practically possible, the analyst will publish a note re- establishing a rating and investment thesis. Investment ratings are determined by the ranges described above at the time of initiation of coverage, a change in investment and/or risk rating, or a change in target price (subject to limited management discretion). At times, the expected total returns may fall outside of these ranges because of market price movements and/or other short-term volatility or trading patterns. Such interim deviations will be permitted but will become subject to review by Research Management. Your decision to buy or sell a security should be based upon your personal investment objectives and should be made only after evaluating the stock's expected performance and risk.

Catalyst Watch and STV Upside/Downside calls: Citi Research may also include a Catalyst Watch or STV Upside or Downside call to indicate the analyst expects the share price to rise (fall) in absolute terms over a specified period of 30 or 90 days in reaction to one or more specific near- term catalysts or events impacting the company or the market. A Catalyst Watch will be published when Analyst confidence is high that an impact to share price will occur; it will be a STV when confidence level is moderate. A Catalyst Watch or STV Upside/Downside call will automatically expire at the end of the specified 30/90 day period. The Catalyst Watch will also be automatically removed if share price performance (calculated at market close) exceeds 15% against the direction of the call (unless over- ridden by the analyst). The analyst may also remove a Catalyst Watch or STV call prior to the end of the specified period in a published research note. A Catalyst Watch/STV Upside or Downside call may be different from and does not affect a stock's fundamental equity rating, which reflects a longer- term total absolute return expectation. For purposes of FINRA ratings- distribution- disclosure rules, a Catalyst Watch/STV Upside call corresponds to a buy recommendation and a Catalyst Watch/STV Downside call corresponds to a sell recommendation. Any stock not assigned to a Catalyst Watch Upside, Catalyst Watch Downside, STV Upside, or STV Downside call is considered Catalyst Watch/STV No View. For purposes of FINRA ratings distribution- disclosure rules, we correspond Catalyst Watch/STV No View to Hold in our ratings distribution table for our Catalyst Watch/STV Upside/Downside rating system. However, we reiterate that we do not consider No View to be a recommendation. For all Catalyst Watch/STV Upside/Downside calls, risk exists that the catalyst(s) and associated share- price movement will not materialize as expected.
